padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993478" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="agonzony"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896833"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.896833.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="agonzony" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896833">agonzony</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-05">12/05/23 17:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a man and this is a 10/10 masterpiece for me. Not sure why they decided to market this as a female's fragrance. It's 100% unisex. Soleil de Feu deserves so much more attention than it gets. Every lady I've shown this to goes wide-eyed. Think caramelized cinnamon creme brulee next to a warm fire at Christmas time with a creamy sandalwood candle burning in the background. It is captivating and lasts forever. The tester strip in my room has had my room smelling like SdF for weeks.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1993478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1993478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966043" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jcee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1214244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jcee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Vanille-Fatale-48029.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48029.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Fatale"title="Vanille Fatale"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1214244">Jcee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-01">11/01/23 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>at first this is a straight up amber that smells like a Avon fragrance for an older lady. love tom ford womens scents but not this one :( i dont smell the cinnamon latte several people mentioned. its just not there. i hoped for it but no. if anything theres a Big Red chewing gum cinnamon scent there at first, not a latte.<br />
then later on after an hour this smells like vanille fatale. if u already have vanille fatale u dont need this. this is very mediocre</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1966043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1966043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1956177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1956177" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KendallLoves"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1432411"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="KendallLoves" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1956177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1956177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1432411">KendallLoves</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-19">10/19/23 14:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a love/hate relationship with this perfume. I decided to wear this on my wedding day because I found it to be so unique and long lasting that it would always bring me back to that day. My Husband wore Eben Fume by Tom Ford and they are a lovely match together. Similar even. I wore it all through our honeymoon in Italy too and it smelt just delightful on warm summer skin at night. At first it is quite cinnamony but that goes away and the sandalwood is so intense on the warm skin with the creaminess form the tuberose it can be a bit heavy smelling but I really don't think it belongs in any other season. But even so it smells like a long lasting skin oil. When I wear it I frequently get compliments. My mom says it smells like the most amazing candle and I agree. The scent alone does not smell perfumey. It smells like waxy burning oil and it is lovely and entrancing but again could be a bit heavy. **Does NOT induce headaches thank the lord and I am sensitive to that**</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1956177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1956177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1948854" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1948854" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PeacefulSunshine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1676840"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1676840.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PeacefulSunshine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Rodriguez-for-Her-Eau-de-Parfum-14319.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14319.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Rodriguez for Her Eau de Parfum"title="Narciso Rodriguez for Her Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1948854ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1948854" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1676840">PeacefulSunshine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-10">10/10/23 18:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am entranced by this at first by the amber and spiciness, but something feels dark and artificial (could be the patchouli-like scent) about it and it's way too tropical. I love tuberose so I was hoping to like this one, but it's such an explosion of cinnamon and coconut (and pineapple...??) that it's kinda gag inducing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1948854"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1948854#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1948754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1948754" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1948754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1948754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-10">10/10/23 15:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I consider this a cozy fall scent alongside other sandalwood scents like Piano Santal and Santal Austral. I did buy a good dupe from Dupeon but as a result I refrained from redundantly purchasing Santal Austral which has a similar vibe, sugary, woody and coconutty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1948754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1948754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1945478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1945478" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kucemi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596502"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kucemi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1945478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1945478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596502">Kucemi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-06">10/06/23 08:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On me, this smells like warm liquorice mixed with amber and cinnamon. The smell is quite unique and gorgeous, but it lingers only close to skin - it does not project much and is quite intimate. I am currently 2 hours in and still holds strong. For a perfume with this price tag, I would expect the projection go way better though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1945478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1945478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1917446" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1917446" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brumbarche"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1001822"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1001822.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="brumbarche" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Art-Meets-Art/Like-a-Virgin-45972.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45972.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Like a Virgin"title="Like a Virgin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1917446ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1917446" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1001822">brumbarche</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-01">09/01/23 19:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose this resembles a younger upgrade of Ambre Gris by Alyssa Ashley (I compared the EDC version, Im not sure how EDP compares, but I suspect it would be heavier and animalic). Here we have tuberose instead of rose and it feels more complex, more sensual and more expensive. Rather elegant and warm, than carnal (which would be the tuberose in Orchid Soleil). The bronze color of the sticker on the bottle indeed represents the shimmery and savory feel that Soleil de Feu evokes in my mind. Despite the name I couldnt wear it at the beach. Its a an urban perfume. Its unisex, but somehow dark pink gold jewelry on naturally sun-kissed skin, stylish comfy white clothing and wide brim sun hat for the last hot autumn days sound like a lovely match for this scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1917446"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1917446#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1910452" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1910452" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AlaskanAngel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348610"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1348610.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AlaskanAngel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Follow-41476.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41476.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Follow"title="Follow"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1910452ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1910452" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348610">AlaskanAngel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-24">08/24/23 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is super warm. Strangely mentholated? Reminiscent of Icey-Hot or Tiger Balm, a medicated topical body treatment. Not sexy, it triggers memories of muscle pain.<br />
<br />
Review of official boxed spray sample that came free with purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1910452"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1910452#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1905112" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1905112" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="b_revity"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1817153"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="b_revity" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1905112ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1905112" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1817153">b_revity</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-18">08/18/23 05:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Intellectually, I can comprehend that this is supposed to be a sweet and creamy floral on an amber and sandalwood base, but somehow my brain keeps interpreting that combination of notes as something more like cinnamon, maybe ginger and cardamom, but in a way that is soft and milky sweet, almost like a chai latte. It gives an impression of radiant heat. Linear. Unisex. Respectable performance. I really like it, enough to have bought the smallest size bottle, but Im not sure I understand the marketing as a summer solar fragrance. To me this is a sweet, creamy, and slightly spicy fragrance that is simple and likable enough to wear any season or time of day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1905112"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1905112#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903978" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1903978" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scissorslizardspock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1026213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scissorslizardspock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Bois-des-Iles-Eau-de-Parfum-41787.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41787.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois des Iles Eau de Parfum"title="Bois des Iles Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1903978ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1903978" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213">Scissorslizardspock</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-16">08/16/23 18:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an interesting scent!  I smell cinnamon bark strongly in the opening, then it melts into a spicy amber, very liquid gold.  Lots of beautiful sandalwood throughout and it hangs on perfectly.  Its one of those fragrances that melts into your skin and then the magic happens.  I love scents like that, they make the wearing experience feel unique.  Soleil de Feu isnt for everyone, but its absolutely unisex, unique and interesting - reminiscent of older TF creations, and it makes me happy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1903978"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1903978#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1901775" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1901775" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tembacat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1814578"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1814578.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tembacat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zoologist-Perfumes/Chipmunk-67998.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67998.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chipmunk"title="Chipmunk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1901775ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1901775" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1814578">Tembacat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 03:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rage, rage against the dying of the light! This is not a sunny, bright fragrance. True to its name, it is a fierce and fiery, liquid amber scent. Notes don't say cinnamon bark but I definitely smell it. Very rich with a lot of projection. Lots of rich woodiness and spice. Seductive. Don't think I would ever wear this outside the home but it might be a guilty pleasure. Only downside to me is the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1901775"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1901775#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1894625" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1894625" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherubina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314162"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1314162.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherubina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1894625ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1894625" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); Lots of black pepper on top. Afterwards there is some sandal wood and light hint of tuberose. Unfortunately, absolutely not the way I expected.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1892430"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1892430#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1892097" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1890806" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gourmandgurl888"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1702884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gourmandgurl888" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1890806ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1890806" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1702884">Gourmandgurl888</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-30">07/30/23 23:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An update from my previous comment: I am SO HAPPY I got my hands on this one because i love it so much! I have and love Tobacco Vanille but this one is like the softer and more summertime sister. Still definitely holding onto that cinnamon warmth and at the start the vanilla is so true gourmand, creamy ice cream like with that sandalwood base that glides in after the dry down but doesnt make it musky but just more smooth and an earthy tinge to the cinnamon. I will still wear this in winter especially on more mild days as it really can be worn all year round, longevity is surprisingly long lasting considering its a softer scent, not crazy projection but only need to spray it in the morning and still get nice whiffs of it throughout the day.<br />
<br />
I would consider this a more feminine leaning scent but guys can pull this off too!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1890806"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1890806#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889988" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889988" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cejvvy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338409"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cejvvy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80083.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil de Feu"title="Soleil de Feu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889988ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889988" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338409">Cejvvy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-29">07/29/23 15:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very good scent. Like a buttery, woody,  vine-leavy, earthy biscuit house. Santal wood is very strong. But creamy. The smell makes you think its familiar but, also its a unique scent. Took it in my collection<br />
<br />
Edit: longevity is very longlasting. It is not screaming but you still smell it next day in your room from your tshirt like a soft coconut tuberose. I actually cant get cinnamon. There is also a smell something like a green walnut shell. It is unisex</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1889988"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1889988#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889200" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889200" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whateverwhocares"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757007.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whateverwhocares" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889200ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889200" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007">Whateverwhocares</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-28">07/28/23 12:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Driving down towards a blazing, amberous sunset. All purpose, fun fragrance. Well composed. Harmonious. Not dense. Not much nuance. Sits on a bed of blond wood. Resinous. Semi-strong. Almost a dumb reach if it werent so particular. Works well. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1889200"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1889200#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1879190" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1879190" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Madalina Dima"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564800"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1564800.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Madalina Dima" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Sintra-62837.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62837.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sintra"title="Sintra"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1879190ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1879190" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564800">Madalina Dima</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-15">07/15/23 06:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminds me of Soleil Brlant, but it's subtler, slighter spicy. It's a beautiful, warm and sensual composition. Oh, my gosh, at the first spray I said to myself that it can't be any sexier than this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1879190"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1879190#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1877624" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1877624" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="phrogfrau"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10407"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10407.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="phrogfrau" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Goutal/Tenue-de-Soiree-39469.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39469.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tenue de Soiree"title="Tenue de Soiree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1877624ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1877624" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10407">phrogfrau</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-13">07/13/23 05:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Remember the Bain de Soleil suntanning products "for the St. Tropez tan" from the 80's? This is the mood of that - posh poolside, beach club glamour. They are not the sporty one playing Marco Polo in the water, or diving for coins, or doing laps in goggles that leave a mark on your face for an hour, not slugging down hotdogs at the snack kiosk with an orange Fanta - They are the one away from the crowd, in a perfectly fitting, uber-chic swimsuit they don't even sell in your town, with large dark sunglasses, languishing in serene, aloof elegance, basking in the sun like a glistening, bronze statue, unaffected by the mayhem around them, knowing they are the epitome of beauty and elegance. I get hints of that exotic, slightly spicy Bain de Soleil scent that was such an upgrade from the Coppertone/Banana Boat lotions- sandalwood, cinnamon, clove maybe? Its subtle though, I wouldn't characterize this as a "Spicy" scent - it's just warm and rich, it glistens, bronzed and sunlit, beautiful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1877624"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1877624#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1873368" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1873368" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Danikirilova"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787105"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Danikirilova" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1873368ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1873368" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787105">Danikirilova</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-07">07/07/23 09:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received a 2ml when I bought Soleil blanc and boy let me tell you Soleil de feu is superior! Strong cinnamon note at first but then it dries down to a soft spicy fragrance with a milky note- perfect for summer. <br />
<br />
I was looking for a clean summery frag that was citrusy and sweet and milky at the same time and I was swatching Soleil blanc for a whole week before buying it(the prize tag is not very appealing so I had to be sure). And I was very pleased with it- lasted good 6h on my skin and a moderate sillage with only one spray on my arm, imagine the over sprayers. So I decided to buy it. <br />
<br />
And the store I liked Soleil de feu on paper, but I was sure that I wanted a more clean frag and the cinnamon note was not it. So Soleil blanc was bought. <br />
<br />
If they had 30ml at the store I would return Soleil blanc for Soleil de feu in the instant! The dry down on Soleil de feu is soo beautiful. The cinnamon is not that strong, it still has the same milky note from Soleil blanc but is more complex in my opinion.<br />
<br />
Think of Soleil de feu as dinner in Greece on a hot summer night drinking wine and eating seafood. <br />
Think of Soleil blanc as lunch on the beach at a boho restaurant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1873368"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1873368#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1872723" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1872723" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dryasiulia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/871690"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.871690.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dryasiulia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frassai/Verano-Porteno-47691.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47691.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Verano Porteo"title="Verano Porteo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1872723ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1872723" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/871690">Dryasiulia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-06">07/06/23 12:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This and brulant are both ambers that can -- and should -- be worn in the heat.  <br />
<br />
This one isn't exactly innovative....but it is glorious under a heat dome.  Plus, in a surprising turn of events the tuberose in this is actually fairly pronounced on me.<br />
<br />
This is what I wanted every time I tried a "sunscreen" scent (which this is on me; it doesn't smell like sunscreen....it smells like how I FEEL when I think of *glamorous* sunscreen.)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1872723"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1872723#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1869539" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1869539" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ShowMustGoOn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345775"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1345775.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ShowMustGoOn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6386.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Suede"title="White Suede"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1869539ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1869539" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345775">ShowMustGoOn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-02">07/02/23 10:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Seems like there are more notes than listed here. I smell something sweet and cinnamon like. Having said that, the most prominent notes on me are benzoin and amber. Heavy benzoin but its not as sharp as in some other benzoin perfumes like in Grand Soir by MFK or Ambre Sultan by Serge Lutens. This composition is beautiful and much softer. If you dont like benzoin, stay away. Love at first sniff! Just bought a bottle at Sephora.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1869539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1869539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1867390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
