padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533">lmnsvgz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-29">06/29/23 12:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>now my life is sweet like CINAMMON. spicy, dry, sandalwood that smells like cinammon due to the bit of sweetness there is. tuberose is barely there, this is not a tuberose-forward scent. a bit more fall-appropriate than another summer body oil scent like the other soleils. IT IS GOOD.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1867390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1867390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1867035" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1867035" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raiza1990"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/865802"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.865802.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="raiza1990" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Britney-Spears/Fantasy-600.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.600.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fantasy"title="Fantasy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1867035ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1867035" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/865802">raiza1990</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-29">06/29/23 01:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is nice. Its sweet and sensual but not sickening. It smells relaxing and a bit christmasy. Maybe its the benzoin? On my skin its the strongest note, with a hint of amber and a soft powder. It smells expensive and a bit exotic. I think its definitely worth trying. Tom Ford is really the best when it comes to designer fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1867035"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1867035#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1865270" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1865270" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="islandgirlmaranda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1255474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="islandgirlmaranda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Nettare-di-Sole-66360.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66360.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Nettare di Sole"title="Aqua Allegoria Nettare di Sole"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1865270ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1865270" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255474">islandgirlmaranda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-26">06/26/23 18:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Testing my new spray sample today. (Glad I didn't blind buy a FB) It starts out with an amazing burst of coconut and a spicy sandalwood. I agree it does feel cinnamonny. The first 30 mins were like that, but then the coconut went away I'm left with only masculine spices and sandalwood. I had high hopes because the opener was so good but the rest has gone down hill. This smells like a greasy spicy man from the 80's wearing too strong of a cologne. Hard pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1865270"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1865270#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1859314" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1859314" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Michael62"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212656"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1212656.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Michael62" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Bond-No-9-s-Island-95710.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95710.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bond No.9's Island"title="Bond No.9's Island"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1859314ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1859314" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212656">Michael62</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-18">06/18/23 14:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Now available online on the David Jones website here in Australia and ordered a bottle asap. Cant wait to try it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1859314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1859314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1853406" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1853406" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dcjimr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1186069.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dcjimr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1853406ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1853406" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069">dcjimr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-10">06/10/23 11:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose it's a slightly spicy sandalwood and tuberose.  About a half hour into the dry down I thought it smelled somewhat like a men's designer fragrance....weird, I know. But now, 3 hours later I'm getting these amazing whiffs.  The sillage is beautiful but I'm still not crazy about it when I smell it up close.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1853406"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1853406#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1852412" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1852412" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gourmandgurl888"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1702884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gourmandgurl888" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1852412ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1852412" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1702884">Gourmandgurl888</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-09">06/09/23 00:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive cracked the cinnamon code! My SA told me it has also cacao in it! So think, cacao (must be very earthy type)  + sandalwood + benzion (vanilla like note) and overall it is cinnamon! Then the amber and tuberose kick in to give that beachy warm vibe, its beautiful and subtle lovely if you like a light amber scent in summer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1852412"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1852412#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1852347" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1852347" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JamesxHorne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="JamesxHorne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1852347ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1852347" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295780">JamesxHorne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-08">06/08/23 21:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cant stand this one. It opened alright but got worse as it dried. Its very pungent cooking spices. My gf immediately made a comparison to Asian cuisine and honestly I can see that, it has the spices youd use to cook with and also the sweetness of like teriyaki sauce</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1852347"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1852347#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1836964" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1836964" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scensitive"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1226445"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1226445.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scensitive" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Jumpsuit-60082.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60082.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jumpsuit"title="Jumpsuit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1836964ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1836964" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1226445">scensitive</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-19">05/19/23 08:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>O K <br />
<br />
the opening is a cinnamon blast with sizzling mandarine that does have, not so much a Hobby Lobby/Tuesday Morning/Ikea Caf holiday rush thing as it's more Pier One/Cost Plus World Market vintage teak x-mas decorations with complimentary mulled spice tea next to vanilla soy wax candles. <br />
<br />
AFTER that 30 seconds is over, . . . wait, hopefully this is the new thing because like some oakmoss and santal perfumes --- this bottle permeated toasted coconut after removing the cellophane layer --- YUM snuggle, . . . Soleil de Feu is respectable beach trash!  <br />
<br />
Tuberose is waxy, vinyl hot ipod ear buds and a flamingo innertube, toasted coconut  rimmed Cointreau cocktail, the super sweet and sharp mandarine peaks in and out of a creamy float.  <br />
<br />
The cinnamon brandishes an amber dry down like a sunset bathing session squeezing out the last drops of tan top up before stumbling back from shower in a white washed riviera chaise.<br />
<br />
Waxy, real doll's head, bubblegum yum.  <br />
<br />
Soleilz Update<br />
<br />
1.  Soleil Neige  -- the best, there's still nothing like it.  The latex in it is like the doll's head vinyl in this.  <br />
<br />
1.  Orchid Soleil --- 4th bottle, my gosh, sensual as the deed and real perf.<br />
<br />
2.  Soleil de Feu --- Barbie Summers in Winter!<br />
<br />
1.  Soleil Brlant  --- most worn, the amber is sweet and spicy with a glossy powder that makes it versatile beyond poolside.<br />
<br />
3.  Soleil Blanc  --  Infinitely likeable.  Sweet coconut whereas this is more ganache, toasted coconut, like a Rafffaelo.<br />
<br />
Bon te.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1836964"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1836964#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1835438" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1835438" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cerulean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/515489"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.515489.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cerulean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Jeux-de-Peau-11350.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11350.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jeux de Peau"title="Jeux de Peau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1835438ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1835438" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/515489">Cerulean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-17">05/17/23 11:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>1/2<br />
<br />
The word "feu" in the context of perfumery will always make me think about my long gone love Feu D' Issey, that mysterious laconic woodiness that Issey Miyake offered in the 90s. <br />
<br />
I was not expecting that this would have a similar style (this does NOT smell like Feu D' Issey) but it is a creamy floral amber made for the summer, just like that beautiful Miyake fragrance. The complexity does not reach 90s Miyake heights, but I just can't ignore that Soleil De Feu is a special -though linear- coconutty amber scent that will make a good companion in spring, summer and autumn. <br />
<br />
Tom Ford offers us a scent with a balmy quality just like a luxurious cream, the same way Soleil Blanc works. This new creation though achieves sensuality with a deep woody accord that is blended skilfully with the amber, florals and the sweetness of benzoin. <br />
<br />
There is little development in general, but from the first spray its charm is undeniable. <br />
<br />
A charm worth the high price tag? Well, up for you to decide. It would have been a five star kind of fragrance if it had the complexity of the "90s feu masterpiece", but I appreciate the fact that I was reminded of vintage Issey's vibe after all these years. <br />
<br />
Is the word "feu" in the name that's playing tricks on me? Or Tom Ford's scouts remembered the "fire of the past"?<br />
<br />
 I'd love to hear what others think.<br />
<br />
The best Soleil out there.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1835438"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1835438#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1834709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1834709" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sticky Wipplesnit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1262280.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sticky Wipplesnit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/God-Is-A-Woman-68664.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68664.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="God Is A Woman"title="God Is A Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1834709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1834709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262280">Sticky Wipplesnit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-16">05/16/23 15:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Before the initial spray, I opened the top for a sniff and was so disappointed. Smelled like a cross between my dads English Leather and the Christmas section of Hobby Lobby. I almost didnt even do a skin test. But Id had a bad day and thought, Even if this sucks, this day cannot get any worse. So I sprayed.<br />
<br />
OKAY THEN, TOM FORD. Nicely done, friend.<br />
<br />
Now THIS is sandalwood done right. The cinnamon top note was not my favorite. Craft store-esque. But it dissipated quick enough. What youre left with is salty beach skin, a faint tinge of Dr. Pepper, and sex. Not like body fluids, but more like I dunno allure. It works. And its HOT.<br />
<br />
But in this house, a perfume cant stay til its passed the husband sniff test. I wandered out to the garage and said, Okay. This is suntan oil and soda. I dont hate it, but I think you might. (He once compared the beautiful Kuumba Made amber paste to a bowl of potpourri.) But to my delight, he took one sniff and was like, WHOA. This, like, IMMEDIATELY takes me back to childhood summers at the beach. He sniffed again. Its different. Another sniff. Babe, this is SEXY. I like it. So I guess its a keeper lol.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1834709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1834709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1834050" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1834050" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bourgeoismisspiggy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/511191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.511191.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bourgeoismisspiggy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Angel-Nova-Eau-de-Toilette-67863.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67863.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angel Nova Eau de Toilette"title="Angel Nova Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1834050ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1834050" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); I'm going to buy this up because I know a good thing when I smell it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1834050"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1834050#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1831773" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1831773" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shokravee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1139090"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1139090.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shokravee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escentric-Molecules/Molecule-01-Iris-66048.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66048.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Molecule 01 + Iris"title="Molecule 01 + Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1831773ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1831773" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1139090">shokravee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-12">05/12/23 20:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>ok this definitely has cardamom, sandalwood, maybe the slightest fig, amber, some kind of a white floral MAYBE, something smokey, sweet resins, maybe the smallest hint of tea. <br />
it's kind of a hybrid between bdk gris charnel + soleil blanc + (for some unknown reason) YSL tuxedo but not the coconuty part about soleil blanc. super smooth, actually impressed compared to the other recent releases from Tom Ford.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1831245" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mdreynoso"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1704671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1704671.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mdreynoso" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Barenia-96428.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96428.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Barnia"title="Barnia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1831245ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1831245" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); It's the faint smell of an Indian dish with coconut milk and spices. Reminds me of Korma! I am so gutted because I really wanted to like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1831245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1831245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1830426" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1830426" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CzarSalad"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1638088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1638088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CzarSalad" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1830426ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1830426" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1638088">CzarSalad</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-11">05/11/23 08:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had gone to Sephora the other day to get something else and inevitably wandered to the fragrance section. At first, it comes across as cinnamony although there is no cinnamon to be found, then develops to a creamy woods type. I had been cycling to and from my errands on the day and the spritz the customer service rep put on my arm lasted through thick and thin of me cycling through the streets and lasted well into the evening. A calming scent that evokes in my mind sitting on a beach around sunset admiring the colours of the sky as they begin to turn into twilight.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1830426"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1830426#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1829458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Wore it to bed could still smell it lightly in the morning- enjoying it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1829458"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1829458#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1829204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1829204" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Michael62"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212656"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1212656.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Michael62" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Bond-No-9-s-Island-95710.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95710.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bond No.9's Island"title="Bond No.9's Island"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1829204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1829204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212656">Michael62</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-10">05/10/23 01:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Released here in a few weeks ( hopefully sooner ) Im told by a very reliable source at David Jones here in Australia .. cant wait to smell it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1829204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1829204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1828891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1828891" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ambroxer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227733"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1227733.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ambroxer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1828891ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1828891" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227733">Ambroxer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-09">05/09/23 15:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soleil de Feu is a ravishing combination of honeyed tuberose, sandalwood and spice. As it hits the skin, it really conjures a mood of bronze, sun kissed skin on the verge of passion. The tuberose is sweet and tender while the sandalwood gives off a sun swept strength. The spice,  think its some kind of saffron, really elevates the whole affair to an extra dimension of provocativeness. These three facets come together beautifully and elicit sunset on a beachfront paradise. As the sun goes down, the temperature heats up<br />
<br />
Sadly, on my skin, that sensation is a bit short lived as Soleil de Feu becomes an overwhelmingly amber scent that loses a lot of nuance in the middle of the wear. I still get hints of saffron and honey, but mostly get a kind of mustiness along with that slightly metallic flavor in sunscreen that makes it so repellent to children. Its a shame, as the opening is such a summery, sensual delight. Fortunately, the dry down gets the house back in order. The amber settles into a more sensuous scent and plays more generously with the other notes, giving back a sense of balance to the overall fragrance and restoring the sensual appeal whole heartedly. <br />
<br />
Soleil de Feu is unisex leaning feminine to my nose. The florals and sweeter elements are relatively short lived and the amber extremely rich. The opening, once again, is the best part. In fact, its the first time in several months Ive been really moved by a new fragrance, so tip of the hat to Tom Ford for the experience. Just stay for the whole ride before deciding if its for you or not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1828891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1828891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1825603" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1825603" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pez_Enelrio"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pez_Enelrio" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1825603ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1825603" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247">Pez_Enelrio</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-05">05/05/23 11:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cinnamon/chai &amp; sandalwood. Warm, creamy slightly smokey but not something I want to smell like. Its a good ambient fragrance for a Spa or for Fall season though</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1825603"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1825603#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1824222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1824222" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="montgomery99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509339"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1509339.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="montgomery99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Sycomore-Eau-de-Parfum-41780.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41780.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"title="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1824222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1824222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509339">montgomery99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-03">05/03/23 16:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First impressions on skin are lots of cinnamon, powdery floral (abstract to me, not necessarily tuberose), and a touch of sandalwood and sweet benzoin. Something sweet and smoky akin to tobacco on my skin as well. It reminds me of something from Diptyque, though I cannot remember which.  <br />
<br />
A bit surprised by its brandingIm not getting much Soleil from this, and thats a good thing as I find almost all of the other scents in this line overly sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1824222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1824222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1822824" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1822824" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="renjun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1738854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1738854.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="renjun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Atomic-Rose-57587.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57587.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Atomic Rose"title="Atomic Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1822824ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1822824" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1738854">renjun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-02">05/02/23 01:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have been thinking about this scent for days. I think the spice in this is so awesome... A creamy sandalwood makes this crazy spicy scent that makes me think it's made of cinnamon or chai without being edible/candy... I'm certain it would layer well with other fragrances for an additional warm/spice scent that could blend with a floral given the subtle tuberose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1822824"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1822824#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1822594" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1822594" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mizmonsta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1529683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1529683.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mizmonsta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/BDK-Parfums/Rouge-Smoking-51468.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51468.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rouge Smoking"title="Rouge Smoking"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1822594ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1822594" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1529683">Mizmonsta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-01">05/01/23 17:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like this one out of the Soleil collection. the scent profile actually matches up: it has a light sweet marshmellow thing from the tuberose, woodyness from the sandelwood, and that benzoin thing gives it that amberyness thats pretty nice. Reminds me of a very slightly powdery tobacco Vanille on my skin, just not as spicy. after spraying it a few days i do notice the longevity to not be there but maybe that will change once the weather changes as its still hoodie season (50-60 degrees).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1822594"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1822594#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1820892" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1820892" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="violeteme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="violeteme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sisley/Sisley-Eau-de-3-5852.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5852.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sisley Eau de 3"title="Sisley Eau de 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1820892ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1820892" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189">violeteme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-29">04/29/23 13:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very unexpected, there is everything clashing together in Soleil De Feu. There is pickle, dill nuance usual for coconut or sandalwood notes. There is chocolate-y amber, creamed by slight tuberose. Overall, it doesn't remind me of a high class perfume, it seem I am smelling something from Estee Lauder (and I literally am, unfortunately!). This is Bronze Goddess, not Tom Ford.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1820892"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1820892#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1820292" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1820292" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iszzieanna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234905"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1234905.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iszzieanna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1820292ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1820292" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234905">iszzieanna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-28">04/28/23 17:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very spicy opening. Like an unsweetened chai cinnamon heart. Quickly the spiciness cools down to a creamy woods with gummy benzoin. Its an odd experience because the benzoin is cold, not warm like it usually is mixed with (say Encens suave). <br />
<br />
This is also like a layering of tuberose nue with cinnamon or benzoin. Waxy benzoin. I adore the creamy sandalwood aspect. But I have SO many creamy sandalwood scents now<br />
<br />
Update: after a few days of full wear this scent was a lot more sticky, incensy benzoin heavy. Along with lots of spices and only a slight bit of sandalwood. Lots of cinnamon, dries with more vanilla tnis time. Lovely</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1820292"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1820292#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1818685" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Also 100% unisex. High quality and beautiful all around...only (minor) flaw is it's not overly distinctive or memorable. Still I wouldn't complain if someone gave me this as a gift. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1817402" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gumbinator"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1030473.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gumbinator" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Cosmic-Cloud-68355.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68355.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cosmic Cloud"title="Cosmic Cloud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1817402ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1817402" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030473">Gumbinator</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-25">04/25/23 13:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just smelt this today in Holt Renfrew. I LOVE this! Very cinnamony on the top initial spray. To me this smells like Christmas time. With all the spices. As this dries, the florals come out, and to me I get a spicy, creamy, floral musk. I dont understand how this is only marketed towards women. This is 100% unisex, leaning male to my nose (only because I envision myself wearing this). I could definitely see myself wearing this one! In the dry down, I do understand the tie in with the Soleil line. <br />
<br />
Im definitely putting this on my to buy list! Wow! Best Tom Ford release so far in 2023!<br />
<br />
10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1817402"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1817402#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1816651" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1625786">Victorm12</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-20">04/20/23 13:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Amazing fragrance. Spicy and woody notes for the first hour after spray. Amber becomes more apparent as it dries in and floral notes come out. Unlike some Tom Ford fragrances it is not overpowering, and wont annoy other people around you. The combination of the beauty scents but also amber and spices of fall is so interesting and sets this fragrance apart from most. This is definitely the most interesting and unique Tom Ford fragrance Ive smelled.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1813555"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1813555#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1812757" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's very nice and quite unique . Still, it's not wow-ing me. Worth giving it a try if you're really curious. <br />
<br />
Edit: ok so I revisit this now that's it's October and I'm really liking it during this weather! Or perhaps my sample is macerating  I don't know if it's 100% full bottle worthy yet but I'm really really liking it. It's different in my collection. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1812757"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1812757#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1810979" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
