Its an easy, non-cloying amber with a cola undertone. It def has a warm weather feel to it. It kinda gives BBW Coconut Lime Verbena with cinnamon, amber and sandalwood.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1809752"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1809752#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1809679" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1809679" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mist Whispers"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1183191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1183191.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mist Whispers" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Ruade-88682.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88682.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ruade"title="Ruade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1809679ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1809679" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1183191">Mist Whispers</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-15">04/15/23 13:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a beautiful and warm creation. Warm from cinnamon and beautiful from tuberose creaminess. I get some tender amber and sandalwood. But what puts me off, I can't get rid of coconut. I know it's not listed, but I can't help smelling it. <br />
Worth 200 quid? It's up to you!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1809679"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1809679#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1808121" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1808121" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Frankie12"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1099530"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Frankie12" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1808121ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1808121" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1099530">Frankie12</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-13">04/13/23 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is closer to Chinatown but less fruity , yet still spicy and creamy in the middle and drrydown.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1808121"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1808121#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1808118" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1808118" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kiettuan77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1383408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kiettuan77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1808118ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1808118" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1383408">kiettuan77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-13">04/13/23 16:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a pretty nice fragrance. Not really a fan of sandalwood but it's well blended with the tuberose and the amber does peak through, but it's mostly creamy sandalwood and tuberose to my nose. Can't detect any benzoin at all. It is a nice fragrance but it's too warm for summer. Maybe warm fragrances are the new trend for summer and freshies will be the trend for colder weather in 2023. But I digress!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1808118"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1808118#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1807394" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1807394" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spcmiller"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/144691"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.144691.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="spcmiller" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cartier/Pasha-de-Cartier-Edition-Noire-Sport-34282.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34282.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pasha de Cartier Edition Noire Sport"title="Pasha de Cartier Edition Noire Sport"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1807394ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1807394" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/144691">spcmiller</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-12">04/12/23 20:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tried it this evening with my son at Nordstrom and Creed's Original Santal immediately came to mind. I feel that the tuberose in the background tilts this slightly female, but it's just middle of the road enough to be unisex. It's definitely tenacious as two quick sprays to each wrist are still projecting several hours later. I'd assume the sillage is equally as potent. <br />
<br />
Unfortunately, all the Tom Fords that are coming out lately are 'meh': they're trying to appeal to too many people at the same time with the same release. What ever you're looking for, this ain't it chief. <br />
<br />
And it's a resounding pass at $300 for 50mls--that's just insane!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1807394"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1807394#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1805712" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1805712" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KBreckenridge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1253213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="KBreckenridge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Acne-Studios-91209.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91209.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acne Studios"title="Acne Studios"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1805712ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1805712" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1253213">KBreckenridge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-10">04/10/23 19:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried it today for the first time and thought it was phenomenal. I smelled a lot of cardamon supported by tuberose, a sweet vanillic amber, and sandalwood. Soft and creamy. I'm sure there is more to the story but this all I could sense. This will be my next Tom Ford purchase for sure!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1805712"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1805712#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1805472" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1805472" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="butterbean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/365534"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.365534.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="butterbean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Rose-Centifolia-Extrait-1-87535.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87535.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Centifolia Extrait 1"title="Rose Centifolia Extrait 1"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1805472ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1805472" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/365534">butterbean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-10">04/10/23 13:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p><br />
<br />
Solar Sun Drenched Sultry Skin. <br />
<br />
Right off I do get the cinnamon but it is blended w a sweet fleshy tuberose and rich ambery warmth on sandalwood base.  All notes blend very well and give off a summery, beach, tanned skin kind of scent.  I love it. <br />
<br />
<br />
*transports me to childhood, using Bain de Soleil <br />
<br />
<br />
Per ingredient list, there are other secret notes not listed:   cinnamon, tonka, and citrus.  ( hexal cinnamal, benzyl cinnamate, cinnamyl alcohol, coumarin, limonene, citral)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1805472"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1805472#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1804191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1804191" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Estelamusic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1316571"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1316571.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Estelamusic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Paris-Venise-49696.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49696.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paris  Venise"title="Paris  Venise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1804191ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1804191" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1316571">Estelamusic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-08">04/08/23 19:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this. Im clearly going thru a creamy sandalwood and floral phase. I get major scent memory with this. Takes me back to 1986 at my aunts house in her backyard. She had tropical flowers and plants and teak furniture on the patio. Playing on the wood patio and the grownups in the hot tub. Eating frozen bananas on a late summer afternoon. Its beautiful. Creamy. Woody. Spiced. Gorgeous</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1804191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1804191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1803187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1803187" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Noelle1210"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1270944"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Noelle1210" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/Note-Vanillee-4334.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4334.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Note Vanille"title="Note Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1803187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1803187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); I get cinnamon and sandalwood mostly. The tuberose stays in the background. Not particularly summery to me,  I tried a couple of sprays in store and it was a strong performer. Not my taste, but I havent smelled anything like it and I always appreciate that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1803187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1803187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1801487" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1801487" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MarsOnEarth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244317"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MarsOnEarth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Unknown-Pleasures-17438.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17438.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unknown Pleasures"title="Unknown Pleasures"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1801487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1801487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244317">MarsOnEarth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-05">04/05/23 16:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a Chai latte. The notes mentioned all play a part and while they can be detected it is well blended. This is a strong like but not a love. Like Soleil Brulant it has a skin like quality about it. In all honesty the whole line has a skin like quality that links them together. I cannot decide how this matches up against Soleil Blanc or Soleil Brulant. Soleil Neige is my clear favorite. I am a fan of the line for sure but I would say try this one out for yourself through sampling or a visit to the store. I grabbed a 30ml and will see how I feel in the long run.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1801487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1801487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799809" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="leatherorrisviolet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1048023"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="leatherorrisviolet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Paris-Hilton/Gold-Rush-Man-41567.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41567.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold Rush Man"title="Gold Rush Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799809ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799809" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1048023">leatherorrisviolet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-03">04/03/23 19:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo already makes a few fragrances that smell like this. I know these notes arent listed, but I get cinnamon and iris. As with most modern TF releases, this fragrance will only blow you away if you dont have much niche experience</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1799809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1799809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1798327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1798327" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Joseebus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334273"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1334273.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Joseebus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Tobacco-Honey-84518.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84518.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Honey"title="Tobacco Honey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1798327ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1798327" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334273">Joseebus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-01">04/01/23 19:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Spectacular and surprising, truly. Starts off warm and spicy and dries down to a soft, sweet sandalwood with just the tiniest hint of that solar DNA. Not at all like Soleil Blanc. I would honestly recommend this for cooler spring and fall weather. Just yummy yummy yummy and an instant buy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1798327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1798327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1797113" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I get some green notes with fish and coconut in the background. I'm gonna give this one the benefit of the doubt because my nose is admittedly a bit clogged from allergies. I might revisit Soleil de Feu later, but my first impression is a hard pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1797113"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1797113#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1796948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1796948" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Germany"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/137168"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.137168.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Germany" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-Cologne-51692.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51692.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus Cologne"title="Aventus Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1796948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1796948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/137168">Germany</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-31">03/31/23 04:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Testing this today and I want it. Its a warm fresh coconut suntan lotion scent. Has  a hint of spice reminding me of big red ( the gum ) in fact it smells  like big red to me. Or those spicy cinnamon hard candies . What are they ? Valentines hearts ? .. not sure. Anyways this is a warm , sensual , sexy scent . My personal favourite from this line. Which doesnt say that much as I do not love this line up as much as others. In fact the last one that was released, in the gold bottle  made me literally sick to my stomach. The other soleils are all ok to me but not a love ! This one will be my favourite of this range and my next purchase.<br />
Its not really a tuberose scent , it concentrates more on vanilla ( benzoin and amber ) and wood  notes ( soft airy sandalwood hint ) than tuberose. Yet I can smell white flowers which freshens this scent up. But it could be orange blossom or Jasmin to my nose as much as it could be a hint of tuberose  I cant detect which white flower  so no its not a prominent tuberose fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1796948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1796948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1795814" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1795814" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SartorialFireflies"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537670"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537670.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SartorialFireflies" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Parfum-49100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1795814ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1795814" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537670">SartorialFireflies</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-29">03/29/23 15:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know if my nose is broken for this one, but I can't shake the association with the smell of dried banana (not the chips, but the sort that still has some moisture) in the opening, until it settles to being a little more overtly resinous. Unique and pleasant, but not FBW for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1795814"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1795814#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1794667" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1794667" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vannamae__"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236771"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1236771.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vannamae__" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Lilac-Brulee-100540.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.100540.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilac Brle"title="Lilac Brle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1794667ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1794667" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236771">Vannamae__</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-28">03/28/23 08:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For the first time in a reaaaallly long time, Im considering buying a TF perfume all because of this. I was able to purchase a 1ml sample of it and only got one wear out of it but I immediately loved the solar, amber, white floral combination. It smelled like a sexy summer getaway. I didnt find it to be an excellent performer sadly but keep in mind I only had 1ml to try but it sat closer to the skin (as many TF frags do these days) but my was it beautiful smelling. I plan on purchasing once it drops overseas since they are a little cheaper in Europe but I feel the price based on the scent alone is pretty justified but the performance for what Ive got with my sample makes the price seem absurd but I digress I love it. Hopefully itll last longer over spraying it and on clothes rather than just on skin. We shall see. Definitely worth getting a sample of!<br />
<br />
<br />
EDIT: Bought a bottle and love it! I like using it to layer with too. Best TF in a long time!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1794667"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1794667#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1790147" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1790147" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MissMoxieMartini"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662425"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662425.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MissMoxieMartini" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1790147ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1790147" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662425">MissMoxieMartini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-22">03/22/23 16:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>TLDR: Soleil de Feu smells like you're sipping on a Moscow Mule while lounging in a cabana on a warm beach<br />
<br />
Love it! This is going to sound weird, but....the opening is straight up Moscow Mule. Yes, I understand how nonsensical this may sound, based on the listed notes, but...it's what I immediately thought of after the initial spray. Now, the dry down: it quickly becomes more linear to the other TF Soleils - solar notes,  with the same beachy vibes that Soleil Blanc contains. Personally, I adore this scent...but it is not a safe blind buy, IMO. Longevity is good. True unisex, with a slight lean more towards feminine. And definitely unique! I've never smelled anything quite like this. I think I'm in love!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1790147"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1790147#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1789259" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1789259" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chesco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249347"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1249347.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chesco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jacques-Fath/Encens-Copal-90771.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90771.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Encens Copal"title="Encens Copal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1789259ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1789259" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249347">Chesco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-21">03/21/23 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White Vanilla Absolute + Sage + lemony Elemi tree resin + Bayleaf + a touch of White Floral (I cant identify) + Amber + Javanol (synthetic Sandalwood)  + Spice (possibly Pink Pepper) + and possibly Osmanthus?<br />
<br />
If there is Tuberose in her its done in an extremely modern non-cloying way.  But this white floral doesnt smell like Tuberose tbh.  Might be just the wrong information floating around.<br />
Has that solar note vibe found in the other white bottle TF frags.<br />
<br />
Sits close to the skin, low projection like most TF frags today to force you to overspray. <br />
Lasted about 4 hours.<br />
Its another great scent from TF, but low projection wont create hype for this with the public.<br />
<br />
Gorgeous fragrance!  Effortlessly beautiful.  Summer dress vibes.  Would kill if a woman wore this in the office! &lt;3<br />
<br />
4/5 Woofs!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1789259"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1789259#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1789055" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1789055" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Latetothescene"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Latetothescene" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1789055ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1789055" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325008">Latetothescene</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-21">03/21/23 11:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This sounds right up my alley. I'm a big fan of soleil blanc, carnal flower, love tuberose and rouge Malachite. Take my money already.<br />
PS as soon as I test it i Will change this into an actual review.<br />
<br />
Actual review: this has clear black orchid DNA and also a dash of Tobacco Vanille in it. I have owned a bottle of both and know those two very well. I'm shocked that nobody (?) made the connection. Own soleil blanc and neige. This to me has little to do with these. <br />
Opening cinnamon, pepper and tuberose. Drydown black orchid + tuberose + cinnamon to oversimplify.<br />
This does not smell like alien fusion. Own that one, love that one. Third bottle.<br />
It's a big no from me because of the black orchid DNA. Does not smell like rouge Malachite . Own that one too. Second bottle. Also, it smells more like a classic French amber fragrance with cinnamon and tuberose with B. O. as a backbone. But to me it's still kind of airy. Not sticky thick like rouge Malachite (again, does not smell like it at all!)<br />
Deep drydown: Velvet Orchid +cinnamon and tuberose...<br />
<br />
I Will update if my opinion changes. <br />
Objectively, it's nice but nothing that rocks my boat. Almost blind bought it. So happy i didn't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1789055"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1789055#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1788799" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399">rosequeen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-20">03/20/23 18:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a chance to have some of this sprayed on my wrist today at the Neiman Marcus counter; the sales associate never let it out of her hand or I would have sprayed it further.  She said today was the first day they had it.  It's just huge.  It's a big blousey floral - amber bomb, and I'm usually never a fan of tuberose.  It nearly glows warm summer. The amber saves it from being ordinary.  That was 2+ hours ago and it's still going strong.  <br />
<br />
I wanted to plunk down my $295 right on the spot and hang the consequences, but I managed to scurry away.  People who aren't retired won't feel so constrained.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1788523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1788523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1788445" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399">rosequeen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-20">03/20/23 18:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a chance to have some of this sprayed on my wrist today at the Neiman Marcus counter; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993478" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="agonzony"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896833"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.896833.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="agonzony" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896833">agonzony</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-05">12/05/23 17:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a man and this is a 10/10 masterpiece for me. Not sure why they decided to market this as a female's fragrance. It's 100% unisex. Soleil de Feu deserves so much more attention than it gets. Every lady I've shown this to goes wide-eyed. Think caramelized cinnamon creme brulee next to a warm fire at Christmas time with a creamy sandalwood candle burning in the background. It is captivating and lasts forever. The tester strip in my room has had my room smelling like SdF for weeks.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1993478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1993478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1798327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1798327" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Joseebus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334273"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1334273.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Joseebus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Tobacco-Honey-84518.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84518.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Honey"title="Tobacco Honey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1798327ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1798327" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334273">Joseebus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-01">04/01/23 19:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Spectacular and surprising, truly. Starts off warm and spicy and dries down to a soft, sweet sandalwood with just the tiniest hint of that solar DNA. Not at all like Soleil Blanc. I would honestly recommend this for cooler spring and fall weather. Just yummy yummy yummy and an instant buy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1798327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1798327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1789259" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1789259" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chesco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249347"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1249347.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chesco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jacques-Fath/Encens-Copal-90771.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90771.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Encens Copal"title="Encens Copal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1789259ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1789259" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249347">Chesco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-21">03/21/23 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White Vanilla Absolute + Sage + lemony Elemi tree resin + Bayleaf + a touch of White Floral (I cant identify) + Amber + Javanol (synthetic Sandalwood)  + Spice (possibly Pink Pepper) + and possibly Osmanthus?<br />
<br />
If there is Tuberose in her its done in an extremely modern non-cloying way.  But this white floral doesnt smell like Tuberose tbh.  Might be just the wrong information floating around.<br />
Has that solar note vibe found in the other white bottle TF frags.<br />
<br />
Sits close to the skin, low projection like most TF frags today to force you to overspray. <br />
Lasted about 4 hours.<br />
Its another great scent from TF, but low projection wont create hype for this with the public.<br />
<br />
Gorgeous fragrance!  Effortlessly beautiful.  Summer dress vibes.  Would kill if a woman wore this in the office! &lt;3<br />
<br />
4/5 Woofs!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1789259"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1789259#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1901775" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1901775" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tembacat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1814578"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1814578.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tembacat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zoologist-Perfumes/Chipmunk-67998.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67998.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chipmunk"title="Chipmunk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1901775ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1901775" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1814578">Tembacat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 03:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rage, rage against the dying of the light! This is not a sunny, bright fragrance. True to its name, it is a fierce and fiery, liquid amber scent. Notes don't say cinnamon bark but I definitely smell it. Very rich with a lot of projection. Lots of rich woodiness and spice. Seductive. Don't think I would ever wear this outside the home but it might be a guilty pleasure. Only downside to me is the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1901775"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1901775#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="80083" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>

Warm, woody and inviting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="2117800"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=2117800#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1789055" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1789055" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Latetothescene"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Latetothescene" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1789055ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1789055" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325008">Latetothescene</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-21">03/21/23 11:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This sounds right up my alley. I'm a big fan of soleil blanc, carnal flower, love tuberose and rouge Malachite. Take my money already.<br />
PS as soon as I test it i Will change this into an actual review.<br />
<br />
Actual review: this has clear black orchid DNA and also a dash of Tobacco Vanille in it. I have owned a bottle of both and know those two very well. I'm shocked that nobody (?) made the connection. Own soleil blanc and neige. This to me has little to do with these. <br />
Opening cinnamon, pepper and tuberose. Drydown black orchid + tuberose + cinnamon to oversimplify.<br />
This does not smell like alien fusion. Own that one, love that one. Third bottle.<br />
It's a big no from me because of the black orchid DNA. Does not smell like rouge Malachite . Own that one too. Second bottle. Also, it smells more like a classic French amber fragrance with cinnamon and tuberose with B. O. as a backbone. But to me it's still kind of airy. Not sticky thick like rouge Malachite (again, does not smell like it at all!)<br />
Deep drydown: Velvet Orchid +cinnamon and tuberose...<br />
<br />
I Will update if my opinion changes. <br />
Objectively, it's nice but nothing that rocks my boat. Almost blind bought it. So happy i didn't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1789055"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1789055#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1948854" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Very impressive longevity too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="2356829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=2356829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966043" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jcee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1214244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jcee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Vanille-Fatale-48029.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48029.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Fatale"title="Vanille Fatale"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1214244">Jcee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-01">11/01/23 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>at first this is a straight up amber that smells like a Avon fragrance for an older lady. love tom ford womens scents but not this one :( i dont smell the cinnamon latte several people mentioned. its just not there. i hoped for it but no. if anything theres a Big Red chewing gum cinnamon scent there at first, not a latte.<br />
then later on after an hour this smells like vanille fatale. if u already have vanille fatale u dont need this. this is very mediocre</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="80083"comment_id="1966043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html?ccid=1966043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="80083" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="80083":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="80083" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
